meanings.definition: A smaller group within a larger religious or political group.
meanings.sent1: The subsects of the church meet every Sunday for prayer.
meanings.sent2: There are several subsects within the political party, each with its own beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The subsects of the club argued over the best way to organize the event.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the different animal subsects formed their own communities.
meanings.sent5: The subsects of the town came together to celebrate a common festival.

meanings.definition: To divide into smaller groups within a larger group.
meanings.sent1: The teacher decided to subsects the students for a group project.
meanings.sent2: The organization will subsects its members based on their interests.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally subsects the candies into different jars for the party.
meanings.sent4: The company will subsects its departments to focus on specific tasks.
meanings.sent5: She will subsects the flowers into different vases for the table decorations.
